answers.answer: You might have a Vaginal yeast infection -- often includes a discharge that is white and curd-like. Vaginal yeast infections can be brought on by antibiotics, birth control pills, pregnancy, menstruation, condom use, sexual intercourse, diabetes, and a weakened immune system. You can buy an over the counter treatment for the the itching/irritation at any drug store. If it worsen's I would see a doctor.
but there is NO DISCHARGE.  Just itching and irritation. Should I try vagisil?  Then if that doesnt work..off to the gyno
Yes, Vagisil works really well. I would definitely try that. I've used it and it alleviates the itching.
in the form of protection  did you use a condom?? if so you may be allergic to the type of condom it is!
yes we used a condom. Intercourse occured a week ago.  Can the itching be a result of the intercoure although it happened that long ago?

yes if you think about it that area is very sensitive and with it being your first time of having sex you are bound to be sore for a while. I myself have been irratated by certain brands of condoms next time try changing it and see if that helps.
those damn magnums.  The crazy thing is that I was sore for a couple days after inercourse and then everything was fine.  Then the itching started 2 days ago. hope it's not an infection!

has your partner got any symptoms of an STD? if i was you i would make an appointment to see your GP.it could jst be sumthin as little as thrush which can easily be treated with cream.As you have used a condom the likness of you catching an STD from your partner are greatly reduced altho as you know nothing is going to protect you from STD's 100% so i would see your doctor.hope this helps :)
yes you've been very helpful.  And no he didn't have any symptoms that I know of.  I intend to talk to him about it today.   Can u inform me about thrush?Again thanks for everything!
i would have a talk with your partner about any symptoms he may have-if anyhttp://www.patient.co.uk/showdoc/23068842/this link should give you all the information you may need on thrush
went to the doc.  couldn't tell what it was.  ob/gyn appointment soon.
great it went away and came back after I had sex again.  What the hell!!!!!!!

question: I had sex for the first time a week ago.  We used protection.  A week later vaginal itching followed by irritation began.  There is no unusual odor or discharge.  Could it be an STD?  What should I do for the itching/irritation?  See a doc?
title: Vaginal itching/irritation
